snippet: Rebels rejected an offer from President François Bozizé that proposed forming a government of national unity, saying that previous agreements with him had been quickly broken.
abstract: Residents of Central African Republic's capital city of Bangui flee into hinterlands as efforts to broker a deal to stop a rebel advance fail, and fear of major battle between government troops and guerrilla fighters grows.

byline.contributor: Christian Panika contributed reporting from Bangui, Central African Republic.

lead_paragraph: Rebels rejected an offer from President François Bozizé that proposed forming a government of national unity, saying that previous agreements with him had been quickly broken.

headline.seo: Residents Flee Bangui, Capital of Central African Republic
headline.main: Fearing Fighting, Residents Flee Capital of Central African Republic
headline.print_headline: Fearing Fighting, Residents Flee Capital of Central African Republic
